cluster_classes.class_description: Various types of stainless steels categorized by their metallurgical structures, including austenitic, ferritic, and martensitic.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Austenitic, ferritic, and martensitic stainless steels are specific families within stainless steels.

members.entity_description: 300 Series stainless steels including Types 304, 304L, 304H, 309, 310, 316, 316L, 316H, 321, 321H, 347, and 347H.
A family of stainless steels including Types 405, 409, 430, 442, and 446.
A type of stainless steel that includes Types 410, 410S, 416, 420, 440A, 440B, and 440C.

cluster_classes.class_description: Different metallurgical structures found in steels, including austenitic, ferritic, and martensitic, known for their corrosion resistance.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Austenitic, ferritic, and martensitic are metallurgical structures in steels.

members.entity_description: A type of metallurgical structure (austenite) found in 300 Series stainless steels and nickel base alloys, known for its corrosion resistance.
A type of metallurgical structure (ferrite) found in carbon and low alloy steels and many 400 series stainless steels, known for its corrosion resistance.
A metallurgical structure (martensite) found in some stainless steels, known for its corrosion resistance.

cluster_classes.class_description: Alloys known for their resistance to corrosion, including stainless steels and nickel base alloys.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Duplex stainless steel and nickel base alloys are known for corrosion resistance.

members.entity_description: A family of stainless steels with a mixed austenitic-ferritic structure, known for its corrosion resistance, including Alloy 2205, 2304, and 2507.
A corrosion-resistant alloy of iron, chromium, and often nickel, known for its strength, durability, and resistance to oxidation, sulfidation, and other forms of corrosion.
A family of alloys with nickel as a major alloying element, including Alloys 200, 400, K-500, etc.

args.new_description: Various types of stainless steels categorized by their metallurgical structures, including austenitic, ferritic, and martensitic.
args.justification: Assigning Class_Group 'Steel Metallurgy' to connect stainless steel types to related metallurgical structure classes.

args.new_description: Metallurgical structures found in steels, including austenitic, ferritic, and martensitic, which determine material properties and corrosion resistance.
args.justification: Assigning Class_Group 'Steel Metallurgy' to connect metallurgical structure concepts to stainless steel types and corrosion-resistant alloys.

args.new_description: Alloys known for their resistance to corrosion, including stainless steels, duplex stainless steels, and nickel base alloys.
args.justification: Assigning Class_Group 'Steel Metallurgy' to connect corrosion-resistant alloys to stainless steel types and metallurgical structures.

splits.name: Martensitic Metallurgical Structure
splits.description: Martensitic structure as found in steels, especially stainless steels.

splits.name: Austenitic and Ferritic Metallurgical Structures
splits.description: Austenitic and ferritic structures as found in steels.

args.justification: Splitting 'Metallurgical Structures' class because martensitic is a distinct structure with different properties and is sometimes treated separately in metallurgy literature.
Martensitic structure is distinct and should be separated for clarity and schema precision.

executed_decisions.justification: Assigning Class_Group 'Steel Metallurgy' to connect stainless steel types to related metallurgical structure classes.
